Exam problem 7: the two sided jacobi algorithm for SVD.
A random 7x7 square matrix is generated:

A=
0.394383 0.783099 0.911647 0.335223 0.277775 0.477397 0.364784 
0.798440 0.916195 0.635712 0.141603 0.016301 0.137232 0.156679 
0.197551 0.717297 0.108809 0.998925 0.512932 0.612640 0.637552 
0.768230 0.606969 0.218257 0.972775 0.292517 0.526745 0.400229 
0.553970 0.242887 0.839112 0.771358 0.352458 0.807725 0.069755 
0.628871 0.804177 0.296032 0.769914 0.919026 0.086056 0.192214 
0.513401 0.400944 0.524287 0.891529 0.949327 0.663227 0.348893 

The matrix is decomposed into the matrix product A=UDV^T. The matrices are:

D=
0.394383 0.783099 0.911647 0.335223 0.277775 0.477397 0.364784 
0.798440 0.916195 0.635712 0.141603 0.016301 0.137232 0.156679 
0.197551 0.717297 0.108809 0.998925 0.512932 0.612640 0.637552 
0.768230 0.606969 0.218257 0.972775 0.292517 0.526745 0.400229 
0.553970 0.242887 0.839112 0.771358 0.352458 0.807725 0.069755 
0.628871 0.804177 0.296032 0.769914 0.919026 0.086056 0.192214 
0.513401 0.400944 0.524287 0.891529 0.949327 0.663227 0.348893 


U=
-0.533718 -0.008352 0.598867 0.078002 -0.166255 -0.447661 0.349725 
0.507597 -0.185227 -0.175127 0.089258 0.296692 -0.706381 0.287053 
0.370852 0.207660 0.390472 0.560713 0.169115 0.415255 0.389155 
-0.487734 -0.193451 -0.603959 0.416368 0.121689 0.115452 0.398027 
0.189985 0.477981 -0.282981 -0.097009 -0.706786 -0.075333 0.375139 
-0.135164 0.435316 -0.032905 -0.570630 0.546014 0.113814 0.392994 
0.166465 -0.683454 0.110870 -0.403928 -0.207960 0.310211 0.436179 


V=
0.015240 -0.430209 -0.724566 -0.125553 0.158088 -0.323587 0.379775 
-0.350320 0.286912 0.301939 0.220575 0.574654 -0.367343 0.435854 
0.383745 0.161085 0.275403 -0.262256 -0.505826 -0.555569 0.343001 
0.331923 0.512697 -0.293124 0.186452 -0.040396 0.495601 0.508951 
-0.137446 -0.215942 0.286258 -0.732788 0.150340 0.410895 0.352306 
-0.615704 -0.204650 0.044211 0.312016 -0.587816 0.135353 0.340397 
0.470775 -0.596056 0.371713 0.444644 0.138417 0.137545 0.221656 

Checking that U^T U=I and V^T V=I:
U^T U=
1.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 
-0.000000 1.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 0.000000 0.000000 
-0.000000 -0.000000 1.000000 0.000000 0.000000 0.000000 0.000000

V^T V=
1.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 
-0.000000 1.000000 0.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 
-0.000000 0.000000 1.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 
-0.000000 0.000000 0.000000 1.000000 0.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 
-0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 1.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 
0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 1.000000 0.000000 
-0.000000 0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 -0.000000 0.000000 1.000000 


Finally checking that A=UDV^T
UDV^T=
0.394383 0.783099 0.911647 0.335223 0.277775 0.477397 0.364784 
0.798440 0.916195 0.635712 0.141603 0.016301 0.137232 0.156679 
0.197551 0.717297 0.108809 0.998925 0.512932 0.612640 0.637552 
0.768230 0.606969 0.218257 0.972775 0.292517 0.526745 0.400229 
0.553970 0.242887 0.839112 0.771358 0.352458 0.807725 0.069755 
0.628871 0.804177 0.296032 0.769914 0.919026 0.086056 0.192214 
0.513401 0.400944 0.524287 0.891529 0.949327 0.663227 0.348893 

Which is the matrix A as wanted.
